659Pkti7WwYoMkJAE0opUg.text: My husband and I absolutely love Bistro 19. The vibe is always buzzing, the decor is modern and cozy. Some of our favorite dishes are the sea bass, the brussel sprouts, the almond chicken and any special they offer.  I need to send a special shout out to the bartender, Tanya. We almost always sit at the bar and Tanya is amazing. She remembers what you order and how you like it prepared. She makes the evening so pleasant with her excellent service and warm personality.  Best pace in the South Hills!

sQbImqODyJZ8TQy_N6oOkw.text: You just can't beat the ambiance, food and drink selection at Bistro 19. A wonderful place for Mt. Lebanon for a girl's night out or date night. Five stars!

eMDXuqyDo3dG9jrysCHfMQ.text: Recently went for dinner and not sure why it had been years....because everything was awesome. I ordered the featured halibut, served with charred tomatoes, a pesto puree, and delicious corn risotto. The fish was super fresh and the entire dish was put together perfectly. My mom had the scallops with asparagus and a pea risotto, and after trying it I wasn't sure which was better! Great experience all around, can't wait to go back.

vzP1FGkC5TnknkhiwBt0cA.text: Had lunch today.  Service was great at first, but when it got busy the two waiters were in over their heads and the manager sat down and ate lunch.  I think the waitress was doing the best she could, but they need more staff.  We ordered sweet potato fries with the burger and they never showed up, couldn't tell the waitress because she did not return to check on us.  We were relaxing, so we were in no rush, but we were in the place for an hour and 45 minutes, a little too long for lunch! I think the "whipped cream" on the dessert trio was Cool Whip -- whipping cream is easy, that just seemed strange to me. We have been here a many times with mixed results, I do wish they would have some new items on the menu, espiecially the lunch appetizers.

kJGiKE_M-UGKqWNfJb-71w.text: One of my favorite  places to eat. Service is always top notch and the food is consistently  fresh and delicious. I have enjoyed several wonderful date nights and Sunday brunches in this Mt. Lebanon staple.

kYSpppIM4EMMja0w6FbZhw.text: Great hip restaurant on 19 in the heart of Mt Lebanons shopping district. Very good service and great entrees.  I'd give it five stars if it had more meatless offerings. As it is there is only one, the spinach  and ravioli which was very good. I would recommend Bistro 19.

B2wyN-TkhunEL6NRXURzRA.text: I'm not 100% sure how Bistro 19 stays in business in Mount Lebanon.   Our waitress was sniffly and snorty. She was definitely not the endearing type you'd think you'd encounter at an upscale little bistro.   My husband and I were there for lunch, so we both ordered the French Onion soup, and I got a barbecue cheddar bison burger, and my husband got a turkey sandwich.  If I was basing Bistro 19 on the French Onion Soup alone, I wouldn't hesitate giving it 4 stars. It was delicious!   They brought out for me another burger entirely, and my medium I requested was very medium-well to well done. I'm not the type to ask to have my food returned for being incorrect, so I ate the burger I did not order. It was ok. Too well done for my liking, and the cheddar cheese was sliced too thick and not melted over the burger.

ACONqQVdiWjZBILsxNme7g.text: Went in Friday night with my BBF to celebration a great occasion. We had reservations and were seated promptly. The host staff is warm and friendly and more than happy to take our coats. Bistro 19 is on the small side and the place was packed with the exception of the bar area. Athena appeared right away with a bread plate and to serve water and take our drink orders. I was in a festive mood and more than happy to try a signature drink, the "Nine-teeni". The drink was Amaretto, Three Olives Raspberry, cranberry juice with a raspberry sugared rim. Very yummy!   For an appetizer, we shared a jumbo lump crab cake with whole grain mustard aioli and served with a bit of parmesan pine nut salad. B.J. thought it was a bit mushy and it was, but the flavor combination was wonderful. We also ordered a Bistro salad to share, but somehow managed to get the house signature salad, the "Pear and Roasted Beet salad". We didn't mind, it was wonderful and included candied walnuts and huge blue cheese crumbles with a nice walnut vinaigrette.   Jim ordered an evening special, scallops with homemade oxtail ravioli, also served with asparagus. Very good. I had the center cut filet mignon, with gorgonzola, wild mushroom compote, port wine demi-glace, whipped potatoes and asparagus. The steak was cooked perfectly and very delicious.  Too much for one girl, so BJ gobbled it right up!   For dessert we shared a dessert special, pearl tapioca with mango chutney. J. thought it was just okay, but I loved it. I have never had pearl tapioca and I really liked the texture, the fact that is wasn't sickeningly sweet and thought the mango was a perfect flavored accent. Also, loved all their choices of coffee drinks. I had the Cafe Joy, which was Malibu, Bailey's and Frangelico. Very good.   The restaurant had a steady stream of customers the entire time we were there. It was a little noisy, but the restaurant has a very warm feeling, sorta romantic, very chic and stylish. When you enter the huge front door, it's like stepping into another world from away from Washington Road.  Executive chef Jessica Gibson does an amazing job and I appreciate her creative specials on the menu.  Service from Athena was excellent. Every dish was served right on time and she was incredibly professional, yet warm and friendly. I love Bistro 19. It's a bit of a road trip from where I live, but worth the trip!

ZJbwlBZ3JHcogcMTxd0kXg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the South Hills.  They are just consistently excellent in food and service.  I have loved everything I have tried here.  And I have to repectfully disagree with Peter F :)  I have had better food and service here than at Legume.

6xM9edHHioTsCeDAQNgrSQ.text: Asian Pear Martini, it doesn't get better!  We love the hummus sampler, too!

RWHqF1yeJW6HO_1KVBf4Lw.text: I was visiting Mount Lebanon and Bistro 19 certainly looked like the "nice place" in town.  I was there on a Tuesday night, and every table was accounted for so I took a seat at the bar.  I ordered a pumpkin ale (yum) and the autumn penne.  But unlike the scrumptious description of the penne on the menu, I found myself eating a fairly bland penne alfredo-alike with some supermarket-tasting chicken sausage on top.  I think it's one thing to be a nice place and it's one thing to have pretty descriptions and combinations on your menu, but another for your food to taste as good as it sounds.  And as far as taste went, the food just didn't live up to what I expected.

ybFxHsAUXZuN-070s-V6qQ.text: This is one of the best places to eat in the burgh!  I've been here a few times now and have yet to leave without having a fantastic meal. I live in miami so I know good food, Pittsburgh needs more places as good as bistro!

nlmZsmElnZGgX29skc52YQ.text: This place deserves five stars.  It is my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh, it is a place where I go for Birthdays and Valentines days, I love the food!  I went there last week again with a group of friends and it was delicious. Great wine and martini selection.  We ordered the Calamari and Fried Green Tomatoes apps which were both great.  The four of us ordered Almond Chicken, Crab Cakes, Filet Mignon, and Sea Scallops as entrees.  All four were delicious (we all tasted everything).  I highly recommend the Almond Chicken and the Filet the most!  But this is one of those places where I think everything is delicious. Reservations are recommend but I have gotten in on Valentine's Day in the past without a reservation, the staff was terrific. Prices are higher for Pittsburgh but you get what you pay for here - it is worth every cent.

iHF82H5243ro-FmtNrOXbA.text: We were a party of three and had a wonderful time. For app, we ordered a single salad which they split into 3 individual portions--which were generous. Things like that sure make a difference to a diner's experience. Our waitress was memorably wonderful. My companions were celebrating their birthdays and were treated to a fabulous dessert--one for each. I had heard people like the Chilean sea bass so I ordered it and thoroughly enjoyed my meal. This was my 4th visit and I will be back again. There are many nice seafood options for non-meat eaters. Only once was I served something poorly prepared--an au gratin side. That was inedible, but everything else I've had on every visit has been very good.

bksXrvj_Ojt8iXuivH-KFw.text: I really enjoyed having lunch here - the atmosphere is relaxed and the food is excellent.  We sat outside and the road noise was a little much, but if you opt for the inside, I'm sure you'll have a better experience.  We both tried the watermelon soup, which was quite tasty and a great summer dish.  I had the tiger shrimps, which were perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious.  I'd happily have them again.  Boyfriend tried the roast beef sandwich, which was, by all accounts, delicious, but potentially a little too rich.  At any rate, a real winner in my book.  I just wish that they had better outdoor seating.  I hear they have a delectable Sunday brunch, so watch for an update.

YaaqLSzBgXh4M1mcOg9IEg.text: I visited for lunch with two friends and thought it was just okay.  The service was less than ideal - they seemed to ignore a table of twenty-somethings to fawn over Ladies Lunching; the waitress was one who doesn't write anything down and brought me the wrong wrap; and there were occasional long delays.  Our group ordered the crab cake, the penne, and the vegetable wrap, and nothing really stuck out.  My wrap and sweet potato fries were very bland.  Desserts were the definite upside - perfect creme brulee and raspberry cheesecake.  The restaurant is also very pretty and there is excellent people-watching.  But the food is just mediocre.

K6Qwyha_Q5RiFCQa3BFMOQ.text: I've been to Bistro 19 a couple of times for dinner but this review is mainly based on a recent lunch experience. I joined a friend who frequents B19 at least once a week for lunch. She raves about the food and reasonable lunch prices. At 12 on a recent Wednesday, there were about 5 other tables in the restaurant. I looked over the menu and decided to indulge my inner carnivore with a bacon cheese burger which came with a side of tortellini salad. The menu had an array of sandwiches and lunch entrees. Some of your favorites were included (burger, wrap) but were done with a gourmet twist. There were also heavier meals (entrees) like almond chicken with brie, rice and veggies. We were served bread and butter while we waited. Within a few minutes, my well done burger arrived. Although ordering well done could often result in a dry, rubbery slab of beef, this burger was juicy and tender. In fact, it was so tender that the burger fell apart a little as I chomped down big bites. The accompanying tortellini salad was light and refreshing. I also chomped down on my friend's green beans which were cooked to perfection with a hint of garlic. Overall, a great lunch experience at a reasonable cost. If you are looking for an above average lunch with reasonable prices ($9-12) Bistro 19 is a great choice.

NVhIag0h2wnZFkfgQxHT7Q.text: One of my favorites, always great food and service. I am always trying new things here even if typically I wouldn't dare, they have a way of combining things that are phenomenal. Owner "B" is always very hospitable, checking on tables and remembering faces. Six stars if possible, never had a bad experience.

51GlGYam8zD_Ky__ZnOOkw.text: Excellent food, excellent service, always consistent. Great drink menu that changes seasonally. Every visit is as good if not better than the last.

yAbO1deF2XEWGsAkRwiSWQ.text: Looooove this place! It is where I come when I'm feeling terribly nostalgic because it reminds me of all my favorite places in my favorite city. Intimate, modern, romantic, quiet, great service, delicious food and a convenient location. My boo and I usually share an appetizer and an entree which is perfect and they always have vegetarian options. Pittsburgh needs more places like this.

sHxQV0h7vZL4V5cr8E83PQ.text: My husband and I really enjoy this restaurant. They change up the menu periodically and we have always had a tough time deciding what to order because everything sounds so good. We have never been disappointed with a meal there. It can get busy any night of the week so I would suggest making a reservation. I love the duck, sea scallops and filet! My husband loves, well, everything, but especially the pork tenderloin. This is a great place to go with family and friends.  Also, a great place as a couple.  Sat at the bar a few times as well and always had great great service!!!.

S0t4qrU2w7nrSzXAnlAlxQ.text: A very nice atmosphere, and even though the restaurant was near full, it was still easy to talk to one another.  For an appetizer we got the grilled vegetable stack which was very well seasoned and not overcooked.  Nice grilled flavor with a little balsamic glaze on top. She got the almond chicken (which she liked very much) and I got the braised short ribs, which was also quite good.  We also split a third entree between us, the tiger shrimp, and this was filled with a spinich and artichoke cheese filling which was really too rich for my tastes, and I only ate about half of the filling.  The spinich it came with was also very salty.  For dessert I got their bananas foster, which was very rich, but strangely, also very salty.  I could understand using a little bit of salt to enhance the flavor, but I only ate about half of it due to the intensely rich, sweet and salty flavors.  Altogether a good atmosphere, good flavors, and good service.

PRalHblpsbI_jon3JbOTZg.text: We have eaten here several times since we moved into the area last year. The latest time was this past saturday. A musician friend of ours was in town and we wanted to take him to a nice lunch before his performance, We could not have made a better choice. We had three different entres and each of us raved about ours. The soup was obviously homemade and delicious. Excellent service coupled with excellent food, I can't rave enough.

E9RskeujJQSnn6P4y_Er3Q.text: The food is expensive but I wouldn't expect anything else for the quality. The setting is modern but cozy. I'm not giving five stars because the waitstaff was inattentive. Friendly, but only came to our table once to refill our glasses. It wasn't horribly busy and as a former waitress I understand there than can be circumstances that pull waitstaff from the front of the house, but two small glasses of water and one glass of wine over appetizers, salads, entrees, and dessert isn't enough. I ordered a Pinot noire to accompany dessert that I never got, but fortunately wasn't charged for. Our salads came out with our appetizer so I didn't have a chance to ask for more water between courses. And I'm positive I was given Chardonnay instead of Cabernet Sauvignon to accompany my entree. This isn't going to keep me away from enjoying a dinner there again but please make sure the waitstaff is more attentive. Thank you.

ETvl9QSfnl0O4g92e5H_Sg.text: We found this restaurant on yelp and decided to give it a try. My first impression was the noise level a little too much for my husband & I. A suggestion would be to hang some drapes that will help with the noise. I had the crab cakes and they were delicious my husband had the scallops and his was also excellent.

txvFsdVUhi68CKGb5YRX-A.text: The food at Bistro 19 is top quality! Every dish my husband and I had was full of flavor, they really pay attention to every detail. I've eaten at Bistro 19 two times. The first time was many years ago shortly after they opened. I remember the food being good but for some reason it didn't stick out to me. Well just the other week we decided to eat there again, pretty much the deciding factor was they had outside tables and wanted to eat outside on a nice summer evening. Well this time the food was unforgettable! Every dish we ordered was amazing! We ordered quite a few dishes. Really, it was too much food but there were so many items on the menu that sounded so good I couldn't resist. Besides, there's nothing wrong with having leftovers. :)  They really nailed it on every dish, the appetizers, the entrees and even dessert. Don't leave there without trying one of their deserts. They have some pretty creative dishes.  I certainly won't be waiting another couple years before I eat there again...Bistro 19 will be a regular on my list now!  They really do deserve more than 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caramel popcorn ice cream
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bananas foster..so freakin good!!
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mushroom ravioli

JkyRQAPocChJEdpMwkFOjw.text: I've lived in SF and LA and DC. The food here is not only phenomenal, but would give many top restaurants in other cities a run for their money. I've literally been here 3 days in a row. And the prices are great considering all the ingredients are local.  Fantastic!

SsCtWsaKaELKz2rzfNirZw.text: Sat at the bar tonight and enjoyed an amazing dinner with great company.  The ambiance of the restaurant is wonderful and the service was absolutely on point!  The Black Shrimp with Risotto was phenomenal.    Can't wait to go back again in the future.

miIpDhxe6xHICjYaZX0fXw.text: Quite good.  It's an upscale, modern/classic setting that's great for a quiet lunch or dinner.  Food is fresh. The menu is concise but offers some variety. Service is efficient, supporting my dining experience without any song/dance. (Sometimes I want a semi-intimate dining experience without establishing a deep, personal relationship with my server.)  So I really liked this place. I'll be back. My lovely wife liked it, too.

jJr7i-r0hHTayL0xE-lqpA.text: I travel for work fairly often & love finding local small restaurant gems to try that I know I can't have anywhere else. I hit the jackpot with this place. If I could've given more than 5 stars to this restaurant, I would have!! My bartender/waitress (Sarah) was wonderfully sweet to deal with - she had some great recommendations for me when I had any questions about the drink/food menu. Just in general a great gal! I got the duck breast entree - seriously, some of the best duck I've had. Menu was wonderfully straight forward! Not too cluttered with random dishes, very cohesive direction & everything sounded super delicious - I had a very hard time picking which entree I was going to have. Would recommend this place to any of my friends that find themselves in this area in the future!!

LrdBSjJmh7Ix9SKkh_u-0g.text: Dinner with friends here on a trip to Upper St. Clair.  Loved it - excellent. I had the duck Breast with fingerling potatoes and roasted Brussels sprouts.  Mary had a Chilean sea bass with sauce- she said that the sauce was a bit sweet for her taste. We also shared some appetizers: the veggie ragout tower, a roasted Brussels sprout salad with sea scallop (highly recommended).  All good. Small restaurant! Reservations recommended.

xaqVmobmz3E3KV18iFPswA.text: I can not think of one thing that I did not like about this experience. Honestly. The welcome from the hostess was kind and friendly. The table setting was warm and comfortable. The server was very attentive and professional, and was also was not uptight. The atmosphere was nice. The place was filled, not one empty seat the entire time we were there. We had to make a reservation because this place is always so busy. The table we sat at was one in a row of maybe 6 tables, but was comfortable like I said.    We started off with the on special white wine and lemon pepper calamari. The calamari was made very nicely. It was not too crispy, which allowed the flavor to stand out. This was also served with a horseradish sauce.    The entrees we chose (which was difficult to choose) were the pork tenderloin and the lobster tail gnocchi. The pork was cooked perfectly. It was tender, not dry, with what tasted like a raspberry or sweet glaze/ sauce. It was also served with squash and a mound of mashed potatoes. The lobster and gnocchi was very good as well! The gnocchi was so perfectly cooked and the white sauce was so tasty! The lobster was also cooked very well. When I put the lemon over both the gnocchi and lobster made it gave it a whole new level of taste.    My husband wouldn't let me try his pistachio cheesecake! But it looked yum! I had the triple threat chocolate cake. I can not express the amount of joy I had received from this cake! It has to be the best chocolate cake I had ever experienced in my life! I will never forget it... *tear*    When the restaurant dimmed the lights, in the middle of dinner, the people in the restaurant all awed, ohhh'd and gasped. It was cute. I can not. Let me say that again. I can't not wait to come back! Double thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pistachio cheesecake
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Triple threat chocolate cake with chocolate ice cream..... Heavenly
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster tail gnocchi

cYv-czjpgv3U8JZ8q-PkoQ.text: Thank you Nina for your great service tonight.  Spot on excellent.  Thank you Chef (Brian?)...all four of us gobbled up every last morsel of food.  I may have licked my plate when no one was looking.  Every dish was simply amazing. My martini was the perfect start and wine a generous pour.  My absolute favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh.  I am not from the area but I stop in every time I am in town. The banana foster is a must for dessert....the peanut butter pie too. I picked the restaurant and you all made me look great! Thank you.

SXg6hGkJ58g3qmPbvUrI7g.text: Absolutely fantastic food definitely 5 out of 5 for food quality how ever I felt the restaurant was extremely crowded and cramped as the owner was just trying to get the absolute maximum amount of tables and chairs in there as possible with out taking into consideration how cramped things would be. Also the prices are definitely on the higher end however portions are very reasonable sizes for a restaurant of this caliber. Will definitely be returning. Would just love to see a slightly less cramped environment.

mQeRtnqwb9Ah8XBaQ-FM1g.text: My husband and I came here for an early evening date night and it was perfect! I had the salmon salad with the most amazing dressing. My husband had the scallops. It was just so good!

BrIFx8pR4-spp7u5ftjx6w.text: Came here again for dinner last night and the quality remains high.  Delicious food with great new specials.  I had the multi-course prix-fix meal which was a peach seasonal menu where every course had something to do with peaches.   This remains a restaurant we consistently go to.

D12BZfpptZq0Mr6jWX8_9Q.text: Bistro 19 has always been one of my favorite restaurants in Mt. Lebanon. I've been more times than I can count for brunch, lunch and dinners. Special occasions to just a cozy dinner with my husband, my experiences are always consistent and excellent. The staff is warm, welcoming and extremely knowledgeable about everything on the menu.   My go-to's are typically the Chilean sea bass, scallops or salmon. Regardless of the current preparation they're always delicious. Another favorite of mine is the beef short ribs when they're on the menu. The menu changes seasonally, so there's always something new to try no matter how many times we return.   On our most recent visit, one new starter item that really stood out was the ahi tuna lettuce wraps. They were served with avocado and hoison sauce and were so,so good. The current salmon preparation was also excellent with mango salsa and coconut ginger rice.   If you're looking for a tried and True staple in Mt. Lebanon, look no further!

hLABk49Cf1mzTxf9HqJhsg.text: Went here for dinner at my hotel's recommendation plus all the great reviews on yelp while traveling for work. I might now need to plan a move from Florida. The good was amazing. I spent a lot of time studying the menu before I went only to throw all those ideas out when my server suggested the featured dish - sauteed breaded pork cutlet with maple Dijon sauce with artichoke and tomato risotto and hericot verts. Knee buckling. The bread and butter is truly unique as others have pointed out. Classy but warm decor, attentive server, obnoxiously sinful dessert with the caramel popcorn sundae. I might volunteer for work travel more often here!

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salted caramel ice cream with caramel corn and peanuts

y68nSTNCEKqLku_cT5GkLQ.text: I give Bistro 19 six stars. I had the scallops with bourbon glaze topped with polenta and spinach. Unreal. Five different slices of bread . HOT might I add. The server was amazing. If you want a dining experience, please treat yourself to an amazing meal. Best in the Burg.

7CylvsAXi7srhrl0_gwjPA.text: My first experience was good...my second...horrible.... The staff is rude, the owner doesn't care and my goodness if you have a scent allergy, stay away... the bartender wore so much fragrance, I couldn't breathe, taste my food or enjoy my wine... and the manager was so rude..... never went back, next door is Pizzaiolo   where I frequent since the rude women in  Bistro 19 think they own the place

4xAcLlfoK_2y7-KaDiyxtA.text: If you're looking for a date night place, look no further. My husband and I love coming here to celebrate a birthday or our anniversary or just for a nice date night. The steak is always unbelievable and you could cut it with a butter knife. I love going here!

mVJA7RQ0DO-Uwu0fsmJqCA.text: I wish I could give this restaurant 6 stars :) I ate here last year & was impressed, but It's even better this time. The hostess was warm and friendly. I ate at the bar and found the bartender to be very attentive. I started with a delicious glass of Malbac & moved on to the French onion soup. It was probably the best I've had. I then ordered the steak salad, which is a delicious mix of field greens, sauteed onions and peppers, fabulous homemade ranch dressing, lots of steak and Parmesan & Rosemary French fries. Wow! So good!!!!

7XX4tnP5DrtPCiZeyVFLoQ.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a while and I finally did with some friends over the weekend. A cute, intimate spot on the main strip in Mt. Lebanon. We had a reservation and the table was ready when we got there. There was a good crowd for 8PM on a Friday and the seats at the bar will filled.   We started wit the hummus tray and bahn mi bowl. The bahn mi bowl was delicious!!   For entrees, our table ordered the braised short rib (very good! Healthy portion! Tasty sauce!), the lobster gnocci (also very good!!), the black tiger shrimp (did not try- had a lot of the artichoke dip in the shrimp with a powerful flavor)and the center cut filet (did not try. Was told it was good, but cheesy).  I also had the lobster bisque. It was very good!!  The wait staff was friendly and gave good recommendations. It was a little slow, but it was busy night.

aUwIqoUn8P5gzVvvL24viA.text: Stopped here for lunch to try it out. They have a bar as well as outdoor seating and free WiFi. When I had called about reservations for lunch I was told that they were necessary but recommended. I could see when I arrived at how packed this little place is.  I was in the mood for a salad so I opted for the salmon salad that had goat cheese and cranberries on it. I was served delicious bread and soft butter to go with it. I found my salad to be very good but thought the salmon slightly dry. Still it was a very good meal. Over at the next table the man had ordered chicken salad on a croissant that came with pasta salad. I heard him say, "if they put anymore chicken in this croissant they would have to exclude the wings" I could see if was huge and it looked very good. He later told me he enjoyed it and was worthwhile.  If you decide you want to order a sandwich or croissant it normally comes with a pasta salad. If you prefer French fries or sweet potato fries then there is a $2.00 upcharge.   My waitress was very friendly and attentive to my needs.  Bistro 19 is located in the Mt. Lebanon business district about 2 blocks from their parking garage. My recommendation is if you are driving then park here because the rates are very inexpensive.  I definitely wish to return here to try out their other offerings. Dinner is available too but again I would recommend you make a reservation. Lunch dress looked business casual and I would assume the same applies to dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French onion soup
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh bread and soft butter always make a salad more delicious!
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon salad with cheese and cranberries

RVTkrAWYhAzXQyFjynQSmQ.text: Though Bistro 19 isn't really close for us, I can't wait to go back. The service was wonderful and the food was amazing. I wish I'd thought to take pictures of it before we started eating. Everything was beautifully presented and delicious. I highly recommend a couple of the courses you could only get on the restaurant week special menu. The Sea bass corn tart with bacon guacamole & brown sugar and ginger seared tuna served with basmati, crispy carrots, and vegetable curry were amazing and my Dad really enjoyed his salmon, too.  Side note: Though they don't say it on their main page, they recommend reservations and we went early, but it's a very small restaurant and I can see it getting crowded easily. You need to call for reservations, but it's worth it to make sure you get a table!

EpwRd0pyvX0pzmvWZTmbcQ.text: Came here for dinner and got the French onion soup and the salmon salad.  I've had better French onion soup but the salmon salad here was fantastic!!!  Fresh greens topped with a nice piece of salmon and a yogurt sauce.  The southwest salad wasn't nearly as good.. it came with a chicken drenched in BBQ sauce and was way too sweet in my opinion.  The bread and butter was good and service was very good!  Would definitely come back for the salmon salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Southwest salad
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled salmon salad with yogurt sauce - so good!
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French onion soup

j1sFCDrcgHoLYpA6RcK76g.text: I was really expecting to Love Bistro 19 judging by its reputation around the area, however, it proved to be just a nice, slightly above average meal.  First off, the staff was great. Absolutely no complaints about our service. The bartender was very sweet, helped us pick a bottle of wine, and was the highlight of our Bistro 19 experience.  We started our dinner with 2 appetizers. First was the calamari. It was cooked perfectly and had a very nice tempura style batter, however, the sauce it was served with was basically a lemon heavy tartar sauce. It turned a nice calamari into reminiscent of eating fish sticks while watching cartoons on a Saturday morning. Not that there's anything wrong with that, was just surprised that there wasn't more to it. Next we had a goat cheese bacon dip, which was good, but very heavy on the cream cheese, which is what I assume they used along with the goat cheese, resulting in a very dense dip. For my entree, I got the pork tenderloin. The portion size was very large for this style of restaurant, and overall it was very tasty. The sauce on the tenderloin was delicious, but the meat itself was a tad tough. The mashed potatoes and squash that accompanied the loin were both ok. My Girlfriend had the raviolis with mint and lobster, and they were very delicious. The mint added a very nice green freshness to the dish.   Overall, we had a very nice evening, and will most likely return. I'm a little more critical of 'fine dining' establishments, and while this was an enjoyable experience, there is definitely some room for improvement.

1PMKEIur8U_za5n-1KYR-w.text: Ordered the Eggs Benedict for Sunday brunch. Exceeded expectations. Coffee was great. Price was very reasonable. The only thing I would recommend is making a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mG2xZYdpGG9XgvFkPzNh6Q.text: Bistro 19 is a great upscale find along the main drag in Mt Lebanon, perfect for a date night. The space offers a fairly decent sized dining room with a small bar enough for about 6-8 patrons. Also, there are some available tables outside when the weather permits.   The menu is a short list of appetizers, salads, and entrees. The other pages of the menu are occupied by the specialty cocktails, beers, and wines by the glass or the bottle.   For this visit I ordered the Butternut Squash Ravioli. The savory squash filling with the sweet cranberry brie butter was quite the combination. Definitely a solid choice. Pair those with crispy brussel sprouts and it was all in all a delicious dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Butternut Squash Ravioli

vHrZmx06Q0-yTedHZyXSMA.text: 3.5 stars.  Decent brunch food in this part of Pittsburgh, and even comes with a pretty huge list of spiked coffees for you to enjoy with the food.  We were celebrating a birthday here, and had a reservation. They were pretty accommodating for our rather large group (~10 people) in their smallish space. I got their grilled salmon salad sandwich, while the mister got his usual eggs benedict. Their sandwiches were good (everyone raves about the croissant), but the eggs were just so-so.  It definitely can be the star of a small town. Coming from a bigger Metropolitan area, this place is lacking a little bit -- perhaps in the freshness of the ingredients? Where Pittsburgh is situated, that could be a bit of a problem that isn't particularly the restaurant's fault.  When you're in town and want to go somewhere that's slightly nicer with a contemporary flair, this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs Benedict on croissant!
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled salmon salad sandwich with tortellini salad and cranberries.

U3fY6dX2XwaqvSv1y3xkww.text: We went back to Bistro19 for a second time and it did not disappoint! Service was awesome! We split the fried calamari and smoked salmon appetizer. The four of us ordered the crab cakes, scallops, ribs, and steak for dinner and everyone loved their meals! Cocktails are amazing! I love the nineteeni ! My husband had the Manhattan and it was awesome! They even had mocktails for our pregnant friend. Desserts are all delicious! You can't go wrong! This place is 40 min from where we live, but it's always worth the drive! We will def be back!!

32RcjbKN0Jl_bgB_Wiqo-A.text: Great atmosphere for a weeknight date night. Meals were good but perhaps a bit overpriced given the execution.   Service was on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck breast poutine w/ fingerling potatoes and Brussels sprouts cooked in duck fat. Not complaining

4DTMXPV05qFwRHpTTNZH5Q.text: My godmother brought me here for my birthday, and this place did not disappoint!  The atmosphere is classy and chic, and the service was not overly friendly but very good.  If I lived in Mount Lebanon, this could easily be one of my favorite places.  We started the meal with amazing complimentary bread and butter. The bread was served hot, and both my godmother and I lost track of the conversation when we tried the butter. What a way to start the meal!  We also ordered a hummus sampler, which came with plain, red pepper, and herb hummus. Again, holy cow. The red pepper hummus was absolutely spectacular. The plain and herb were also excellent, but we definitely polished off the red pepper first. Best of all, you can order this hummus for takeout  The actual meal was just as yummy. I LOVED the lobster macaroni and cheese, and it was loaded up with lobster. The actual Mac and cheese was delicious too.  My godmother ordered the crab cake, which was good, but it was definitely the weakest part of the meal. The sides were really odd, as rice and green beans did not go well with a crab cake.  Nonetheless, we really enjoyed our meals, and the lunch prices were crazy reasonable.  All the time while we were eating, we enjoyed some peach bellinis. They were very bubbly and a bit lacking in peach but all in all good.  There were loads of interesting drink options to choose from.  As we had heard from others that many unique characters come here, we were very excited to people watch. We were not disappointed on this front either, although the patrons are not controlled by the establishment.  The only downside is that their to-go containers leak really badly. All three of our boxes leaked.  Overall, this is a great place at lunch for a business meeting or nice meet up with friends. At dinner, it would be great for date night!

3u6rDVslkJMoTvCWrm9I6A.text: Bistro 19 is an intimate restaurant to get a classy dinner. Reservations recommended as seating is limited. Bar seating available. It can get loud but is not as bad as other places I have been. The server was professional and very friendly.  We had reservations and we were seated immediately. The setting is intimate in the evening so I think it's best for small groups.   I think this is moderate on the price scale as we spent around $100 for 2 people including drinks and desserts. However, I think the delicious meal is definitely worth the price paid.   My only complaint is that my pumpkin ravioli were a little al dente for my taste. The calamari appetizer and Caesar salad was slightly lacking in flavor and I would try something else should I return. The tiger shrimp dinner was phenomenal and I highly recommend it! Both the banana foster Napoleon and bread pudding were fantastic and I would get either one again.  Overall, I was very satisfied with my meal and experience and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bread pudding dessert
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pumpkin ravioli
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caesar salad

mcLu2KfZNDC1PVbW3OnDQw.text: I really struggled to rate this one. To start the interior is very modern and I loved the sliding doors that open up next to the outdoor seating! These were open when we sat down and then the manager closed them. As he was closing them we overheard him using explicit language because he couldn't get the doors to shut properly. Now I'm not saying I don't drop swear words, because I do, but as a customer it seems a bit unprofessional.   On another note, the waitress was very knowledgeable and attentive. She asked if we wanted more bread and that was a no brainer bc it was so GOOD! She was also great about filling our drinks. We both ordered the almond chicken with risotto and spinach. The chicken was good, a tad bit dry, but that Brie creme sauce helped out a bit. We both thought the chicken pieces were pretty small too for $20 a plate. The risotto was probably my favorite part because it wasn't overpowering with cheese. At this point I'm not sure how I feel about returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Almond Chicken

-AM9JQgkVY4xJZAPVi8tKQ.text: I happen to hear about this place from a comment a fellow "Yelper" left me after I tried a restaurant down the street.   We got the Lemmon pepper calamari for an appetizer, which was delicious but was a little over cooked for my taste.  I ordered the Ahi Tuna Lettuce Wraps for my dinner and I could of ate ten more of those thing. The tuna was prepared to perfection then the shiitake mushrooms and avocado complimented it very well.    My dinner partner ordered the steak salad which came with nice chunks of meat cooked to his liking. It had peppers, onions, and rosemary parents ran fries on too which I so gracefully stole one of those to try. He said it was one of the best steak salads he ever had.  The ambiance was nice but it is a small place. We made reservations and I recommend it there was a half hour wait to be seated when we arrived. Also their wine list was very impressive but we opted not to try any this time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ahi Tuna Lettuce Wraps
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lemon Pepper Calamari

f38DGhAQOxQu07P-4JMpTw.text: Holy. Moly.  I have found my absolute new favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh.  My meal on Saturday night was probably the best meal I have ever had at a restaurant.  We had 8:30pm reservations and made the trek over just in time for dinner.  It is on the corner of a main drag in Mt Lebo and is super cozy and intimate when you walk in. Bobby and I agreed that Bistro has an excellent use of space and albeit sitting close to other diners, it didn't feel uncomfortable or too packed at any time - and most every table was full during our visit.  We started with the house pinot grigio and a jack on the rocks and after our bread & butter arrived, so did our lemon pepper calamari appetizer.  The bread was warm and fresh and the butter was soooo good.  The calamari was perfectly cooked, lightly breaded and served in a portion large enough for 4 or more people to share.  Bobby ordered the crab cakes (served with garlic mashed potatoes and perfectly cooked carrots) and I ordered the almond chicken (served with a risotto and cooked spinach).  Portions were extremely generous - enough to eat half and take the other half home to eat later. Everything was absolutely delicious.  I noticed that while at most restaurants, food comes out warm, but here, our food came out piping hot. The crab cakes were huge and with lumps of tender crab and the mashed potatoes garlicky, and carrots perfectly cooked and flavorful.  My chicken was tender and juicy and the risotto was cheesy and amazing with garlic butter spinach that was not too bland or mushy.  Our service was good, our waitress attentive and friendly.  The desserts at the table next to us looked good, but we were too full to try.  I had high expectations based on the photos other reviewers have posted here, and they were exceeded in both presentation and flavor of the food we had Saturday night.  I would totally love to try every entree and appetizer on the menu and I've already said I want to come back for my birthday in April. It was an easy 5 stars.

uLBDKKdBITzMkMLdkgN57w.text: I'm going to make a bold statement and say this is probably one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh. Why? Because it's ALWAYS consistently excellent.  My only experience had been for lunch, but I finally made it to dinner and I have to say, what took me so long?? It was incredible.   I ordered "what they're know for" (as the waitress said), the Chilean Seabass. Another bold statement, it may be one of the best dishes I've ever had! It was so light and fluffy, but packed with flavor. Mainly because the horseradish glaze was out of control good. Add on a delicious mix of slaw and rice and it was the perfect dish.  Please, city folks, do not poo poo coming out to the South Hills! It's so worth the annoying ride up West Liberty, promise!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chilean Seabass
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana Foster

pr02D_yTB92Z9cjWVzpVaQ.text: *Angels Singing* *Harps Playing* Holy Moly! What a glorious restaurant experience at Bistro 19. This restaurant has been on my "to visit" list for years now, but I just never make it out to Mt. Lebanon. I finally got to visit with a group of friends during restaurant week and I have to say that I'm so glad I left the grit and grime of the city to venture across a very fancy crosswalk and into B19.    We made a reservation for 6:30 and were seated right away. I started off the night with an "Apples and Pears" cocktail which consisted of apple infused Boyd & Blair vodka, pear nectar, Angostura bitters, vanilla-nutmeg syrup, fresh lime juice, and hard cider. It was like someone poured the spirit of Christmas into a mason jar-- perfectly spiced and perfectly wonderful.  After drinks, we ordered a trio of hummus to share: plain, pesto, and red pepper. The hummus was a hit.   Next came a basket of bread and butter. The butter got some major praise around the table. I inquired about the butter because it was just too good and I couldn't place the flavors. Turns out it's a honey and chive whipped butter. Who knew that those flavors would go together so well.   We all decided to try out the Restaurant Week special menu. For $35.16 we got to pick between two appetizers, two main courses, and two dessert options. I opted for the wild burgundy snails and leek goat cheese fondue on a baguette for my first course,  the roasted lamb gnocchi for my second course, and chocolate bundt cake to round it out.  The snails were good and the cake was good, but the lamb + gnocchi really stole the show. The lamb was so tender and with just the right amount of fat, that it practically melted in my mouth. The gnocchi were seasoned perfectly and cooked perfectly. I think I lost the ability to speak for a good 15 minutes. The only sounds I could make were repeated "mmmmmms". It was definitely one of the best dishes I've eaten in Pittsburgh.  Overall, it was a great experience. The service was top-notch and the atmosphere was the perfect mixture of comfy and classy. My only regret is not trying Bistro 19 sooner. Just think of how many honey chive butter experiences I could have had by now if I visited 5 years ago when I first heard of the place....

eEBu6AwWiMedti6pJVR-zA.text: The crab cake is on point and I'm from Maryland and had high expectations. I typically order this or the filet mignon which also does not disappoint. They make a great cosmopolitan cocktail and the service is great. Definitely need a reservation most nights, but as a solo diner I've been able to grab a seat at the bar for dinner.

wKSGHVyHO0uxajJv28P7Mw.text: Apparently our money wasn't good enough. We have some friends in town and wanted to treat them to a nice brunch. We noticed on their restaurant website that they recommended reservations. They open at 11, so we started calling their restaurant at 9 AM. We tried several times to get through and no answers. There, also, wasn't an online option for making reservations. We showed up as soon as they opened and requested a table. We noticed they barely had any customers and plenty of large tables were empty. They informed us they won't seat us without a reservation. We asked them how could we make a reservation when no one in their restaurant was answering the phone. They informed us that none of their wait staff even showed up until 10 minutes ago. So... No one comes in to prep the kitchen? What about their management team? Instead of providing some answers, their very rude hostess walked away. I'm very disappointed because my boyfriend and I had had a previous good experience at Bistro 19. We didn't expect to be treated like garbage today.  I wouldn't have been angry if their staff and politely informed us that they already had their tables reserved for other clients. I wouldn't have been angry if their website stated reservations were mandatory. Instead, we were talked down to and given no explanations why they wouldn't seat paying clients in a mostly empty restaurant. None of us were wearing offensive clothing or tattoos. We were all clean and dressed nicely. I can't think of any reasonable explanation (barring outlandish things like prejudice, since our group was of mixed race and we had a disabled individual - and I definitely hope this wasn't the case) why any restaurant would turn us away if they had tables available.

k7HnCRWr5NPQD2o4Kfu7HQ.text: Went to dinner on a Thursday night around 7:30. The place was full but we were the only people under 50 at the restaurant, so the general ambiance is kinda weird. You're also very close to the tables next to you, I could hear conversations happening all around me.   Food: The bread basket is delightful, fresh warm bread served with a sweet cream butter. Ordered the filet mignon and lobster gnocchi. Both were delicious. The meat dish had a lovely red wine reduction, the lobster tail was a decent size and well seasoned.   All in all a good meal, however, there are so many great places with very imaginative menu options, and Bistro 19 seems like a very basic and ordinary menu done well. Enjoyed my time there but wasn't blown away.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Well seasoned and cooked lobster tail. The gnocchi was not overly rich and a perfect consistency.
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet mignon portions are supposed to be small (7-8 oz) , but this was substantially less. Wine sauce was very good.

NyCMQSFCgTbpoUl9NEZUvw.text: We visited on an unexpected Friday night with the hope of sitting at the bar. Be advised that if you do not have a reservation and intend to sit at the bar, you should plan to arrive at opening as bar seats are also highly coveted. It was a hot day so we were lucky enough to be some of the only people interested in dining outside. Lucky for us, the sun was starting to set so it did cool off as the evening progressed. Our server was wonderful, he recommendation for a crisp white wine was right on point and her knowledge of the menu extensive. I had heard such amazing things about the seabass but wasn't in love with the described side dishes. My fears were baseless as this seabass was truly the most amazing preparation I've ever had. It was perfectly prepared and just divine. I can't wait to return!!!

rbO5UAPxMIbStXSSNhKJ6A.text: Lovely little bright spot on Mt. Lebanon's Washington Road. There are many dining options within a few blocks, but Bistro 19 outshines. Inventive menu, artfully prepared and served with professionalism and attention to detail. Decor is simple, yet tasteful and the staff very friendly. Recommend reservations.

i7W0wUcOTDPcwlEEqrgxeQ.text: An outstanding dinner with our road crew tonight. B19 took our short- notice reservation with the qualifier that we try to contain our meal to two hours due to a later group coming in. No problem...although interestingly, a credit card was requested "in case we didn't show"...  When we got in, table had already been prepared and we were seated immediately. Table service was also immediate, menus were available and water was offered. This was a very nice menu including some beef, lamb, pork, chicken, and fish. There were even a couple of options available that made our vegan member quite happy.  The group ordered drinks, then our mains as well. I had the Chilean sea bass with the horseradish crust.  There was no argument when we requested substitutions - I chose grilled asparagus over the Napa slaw - and then we settled in and waited.  We're not a quiet group but the level of conversation and the ambiance in Bistro 19 worked well for us.  We may have been the least well dressed and quite possibly the aggregate youngest group in the restaurant but we were treated with a level of respect which appropriately reflected the professionalism of the wait staff.  Within a reasonable amount of time, our dinners were delivered.  Portions were adequate, and well-presented.  Always a bellwether for a restaurant, our pickiest eater admired, and then devoured her filet.  This is someone for whom a clean plate is foreign and, upon reflection, said that her steak was perfectly prepared and that the flavor of the toppings was "exotic".  Equally pleased was our group leader who wanted nothing more than the Bistro Burger.  He mentioned that it was one of the best burgers he'd had in a long while.  I certainly enjoyed my fish - the light but evenly cooked and seasoned crust was superb and the asparagus was very nicely prepared.  The macadamia rice was a bit of a let down, a bit dry and not overly flavorful but really didn't distract from the balance of the dish.  While desert was offered, we'd noticed a Grater's Ice Cream store down the road and chose to head over there rather than take B19 up on their offerings.  Maybe a pedestrian choice but we're a pretty generic group.  Total bill was $770 (including the aforementioned 20% gratuity).  Quite reasonable for a dozen diners, several drinks, and even a couple of bottles of a nice chardonnay. If we're ever back in the area, we'll be back.

TxKzxq15_EKChBlkzjUgnw.text: I had dinner here last night with a friend before an event and it was a lovely experience! During the week, we got there at 5 and a reservation was definitely not necessary. I was promptly greeted by a friendly waiter who provided us with excellent service throughout the night.   We each started with wine - a red for me and a white for her - and enjoyed the selections very much. I also had a nineteeni which was good, but not anything special.   We started with the cheese plate and salmon sliders. I loved the cheese plate and the nice spread and selection of crackers, fruits and toppings. It included a cheddar, Swiss, and bleu cheese. The salmon sliders left me underwhelmed, lacking a punchy flavor. However, I did enjoy the paired sweet potato fries!   We split the special for the evening - lobster ravioli. This was fabulous! A creamy sauce with lobster both in the sauce and in the pasta.   We finished with the cookie skillet which is pretty much as good as it sounds and that's all there is to say about that :)  A great place if you're in Mt. Lebanon!

LyK8PFY2KUxqsPAF1RbaoQ.text: I stopped in for lunch one day when I was working in the area. Bistro19 had a great atmosphere. I was attended to quickly, and was met with great service. The wait staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and quick on refills. There was a pretty decent beer list. The menu was on the smaller side, which is a good sign that the food is fresh.   I ordered the Bistro Burger. The patty was cooked medium, the way I ordered. It came with a roasted garlic ketchup, which I don't think was prepared well; it was very watery and leaked everywhere, soaking the plate. Perhaps a thicker ketchup, or even changing it to a spicy ketchup would better complement the burger. There could have been a better melt on the cheese as well. The French fries were great. It's surprising how many restaurants can't get French fries right. This restaurant has a lot going for it, so I'd love to come back and try something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bistro Burger with fries

QFxhmdGuoV-be1TfsmUzCg.text: How on earth have I never reviewed a place where I eat almost weekly? I love Bistro. The staff is fantastic, the food is consistently good, and the atmosphere is nice-casual and usually very relaxing. Drinks are healthy pours and the bartender, Sarah, is delightful. If the menu changed more often it could be a five-star place but as it stands it is a really solid high-end neighborhood joint.

8r-fBmszmjBruexDx9WZHA.text: Hands down, BEST overall dining experience that I've had in.. forever. I wish I could give bistro 19 6 stars, truly.  Make reservations in advance! It's a small, intimate space. I called the day of and the first available for two people was around 8:15 (we got there by seven and luckily grabbed a seat at the bar instead of waiting until 8:15)  Bartenders were slammed, still managed to remain attentive on a Saturday evening.  It was my b day weekend so we went all out, our appetizer was a seasonal flatbread with figs... YUM.... amazing.... my entree was the scallops, which were Hot and full of flavor. My friend got friend he duck, it came with seasonal risotto and it was phenomenal!! For dessert we had both the pumpkin pie cheesecake, and banana foster. Foster looked pretty but the cheesecake was OUT OF THIS WORLD!  I will be coming back to bistro 19, ASAP... I also recommend this restaurant to anyone for any occasion. It's nice enough to be a "nice night out" but wouldn't say it's "too nice" to just stop by on a weeknight for no special occasion. Highly recommend!   On a side note: I would feel that the menu changes frequently, last night there were TONS of fall notes included, pumpkin puree.. apple puree, figs, just a total combination of tall flavors.. loved every

DVTYkFtsaVcv5GNdQNGzOQ.text: Stopped here for a weekday dinner. We ordered the cheese plate, almond chicken and duck breast. Everything was very very good.  I definitely recommend this place.  Meals were plated perfectly. The portions were the right size. Everything was just really good. I'm looking forward to going back to try some other entrees.

atWOh9V0KcyRvxYni8vHeA.text: Excellent food we have never been disappointed with anything we've ordered there however I believe it's on the expensive side for Pittsburgh so I'm  rating the restaurant  4 stars

sTy-6d6U1ui4_ruYLuDVkQ.text: The food for this place was not good at all. I got the burger and my friends got the steak and we were all disappointed. I am just giving one star because the staff was nice.  My burger fell apart because the drenched the bottom bread with ketchup and so I ate it with a fork and knife. We all ended up eating my fries. The sauce on the steak was not good at all and the mashed potatoes were not even touched.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tPw4Igy0od4LBq8GiYNtXA.text: Came here for brunch on a Sunday as was excited to try their brunch menu. The prices are very reasonable for Bistro 19. I had the eggs benedict, which was poached eggs on croissant, prociutto, and hollandaise sauce with home fries. The eggs benedict was delicious. My friend had the creme brulee french toast and loved it! Overall, a nice place to have brunch in the Mt Lebanon area.

lDGH2MaYMgu2tiU3OOahyQ.text: We didnot realize that this is a fine dining place until we were seated. After a tiring bowling night, this was among the few options that were still open at 9:30 pm and they also have a good rating on Yelp.   Our waitress was friendly and nice. Service was on time. They offered some bread like any other high end restaurant. We ordered two staters: colossal lump crab cocktail and lamb flat bread; and two entree items: almond chicken and bay of Fundy salmon. It  was a sufficient quantity for four of us.  Starters first! Crab cocktail is cooked crab served over a bed of fresh ripe mango salsa and avacado. It had a subtle tangy flavor. There are other ingredients too, but  these were noticeable. Its an amazingly refreshing touch to the palette. I definitely recommend this dish. Coming to the lamb flat bread. It is lamb meat balls, feta cheese, tomatoes, arugula and fresh yogurt sauce served over a naan. The best part of this dish is the juicy well cooked lamb. If you like lamb, you should definitely try this.   Now the entrees, my favorite is almond chicken. This dish is on the sweeter side. I liked it very much especially the combination with creamy risotto and spinach. If you are a greens lover, do give this a try! Ok...the salmon. I am not a big fan of salmon. So, I will just discuss about the well cooked basmati rice served with a mildly spicy sauce which might consist of cream and butter. My friends liked the salmon too.   Overall, it was a good experience and it would have been a great experience if we were prepared for a fine dining experience. Will go back again for a date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Almond chicken....look at that creamy risotto!!!
Photo of Bistro 19 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb flat bread! Lamb lovers might not want to miss this item.

_fhaSTMGRqx9IPfJMdJBWg.text: I ate here for lunch in the middle of a work day. I had a craving for a pasta dish and I was so excited to see the parmesan chicken penne pasta. The chicken was grilled with melted cheese. The pasta was tossed with olive oil and sweet peppers which was a nice touch. I would have loved some freshly grated parmesan cheese, but the dish was delicious. The atmosphere was cozy and beautifully appointed. The best part of the meal was the fresh bread and herbed butter. Definitely give this restaurant a try!

jG4CiDjzE-nnfbjk2DHPiQ.text: Food was delicious. Salmon sliders were flavoring. Brussel sprouts were tasty. They didn't have the scallop entree as displayed in one of the pics...said it was a seasonal dish, so I got the next best thing to it, which was ok.

PgF5itIJsluEq0gK-VLp6Q.text: Wow! I loved Bistro 19 last night. We have lived in the are for a long time and have never stopped in until now. My boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner and made a reservation in advance. It was very busy on a Friday night, so I recommend having a reservation. Our waitress was very nice and accommodating the entire evening. The drink and cocktail menu was lengthy and I decided to go with the prosecco, it was delicious. They give you bread to start with and the best butter ever, haha. Yum!For dinner, I couldn't decide between the Black Tiger Shrimp or the Crabcakes. I'm glad that I went with the Black Tiger Shrimp because it was honestly one of the best meals I've had in a long time. It was stuffed and topped with a rich cream sauce and had spinach and risotto on the side. My boyfriend ordered the Pork and he also didn't have anything left on his place once he was done. We got the Chocolate Cake for dessert which was also very good. The only thing was that my ice cream came out already melted, but the woman did apologize for that. Staff was very nice. It is an upscale dining and pricy meal, but a night out once in a while made it worth it for the nice evening we were able to have. We will be back in the future for sure!

GQ6pIQ75sJrs5iOHpkyq8g.text: I've been here a few times and after our latest visit, I feel Bistro 19 definitely deserves a 5 star review. Although I haven't been impressed in the past, their menu changed from what I remember from years ago (and I believe it might change quite often with what is in season). I loved everything about this most recent visit.   Between my husband and I, we ordered the French onion soup, salmon sliders, sea scallops, and pork tenderloin. Everything was on point. French onion soup was one of the best I've had. The salmon sliders were flavorful and the yogurt sauce on them created a refreshing flavor to balance with the rich salmon. The sea scallops were one of the best scallop dishes I've ever had; they were perfectly seared and seasoned, with a sweet yet savory sauce. It was paired with a polenta and the combinations were perfect. The pork tenderloin was also fantastic with great balances of sweet and savory. According to our waitress, the pork tenderloin is one of their most popular dishes.   The decor is very sleek and modern, while the space is rather small. We came here on a weeknight  so it wasn't too busy; we were able to get a table with no problems. However, I would imagine dinner on a weekend would require a reservation.   A place that has some dishes that I can rate as "one of the best I've ever had" definitely deserves five stars! Highly recommend Bistro 19!
